<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The helper class to build type name based on DIE properties.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It builds synthetic name based on explicit attributes: DW&#95;AT&#95;name,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// DW&#95;AT&#95;linkage&#95;name or based on implicit attributes(DW&#95;AT&#95;decl&#42;).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Names for specific DIEs(like subprograms, template classes...) include</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// additional attributes: subprogram parameters, template parameters,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// array ranges. Examples of built name:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// class A &#123;  &#125;                    : &#123;8&#125;A</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// namspace llvm &#123; class A &#123;  &#125; &#125;  : &#123;1&#125;llvm&#123;8&#125;A</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// template &lt;int&gt; structure B &#123; &#125;  : &#123;F&#125;B&lt;&#123;0&#125;int&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// void foo ( int p1, float p3 )   : &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int, &#123;0&#125;int)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// int &#42;ptr;                       : &#123;c&#125;ptr &#123;0&#125;int</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// int var;                        : &#123;d&#125;var</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// These names is used to refer DIEs describing types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#ae3ed13db9bc68f498cef6781d0c56f76">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#ae3ed13db9bc68f498cef6781d0c56f76"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#ae3ed13db9bc68f498cef6781d0c56f76">SyntheticTypeNameBuilder</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/typepool">TypePool</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#a64b89caefc9c557f7d6e6b89657a6e04">TypePoolRef</a>) : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#a64b89caefc9c557f7d6e6b89657a6e04">TypePoolRef</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf-linker/parallel/synthetictypenamebuilder/#a64b89caefc9c557f7d6e6b89657a6e04">TypePoolRef</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Analyze \\p InputUnitEntryPair for the type name and possibly assign</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// built type name to the DIE&#39;s type info.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NOTE: while analyzing types we may create different kind of names</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for the same type depending on whether the type is part of another type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// f.e. DW&#95;TAG&#95;formal&#95;parameter would receive &quot;&#123;02&#125;01&quot; name when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// examined alone. Or &quot;&#123;0&#125;int&quot; name when it is a part of a function name:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#123;a&#125;void foo(&#123;0&#125;int). The \\p AssignNameToTypeDescriptor tells whether</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the type name is part of another type name and then should not be assigned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to DIE type descriptor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
